faq.question: How do I apply?
faq.answer: Applications are submitted through our online portal. If you are applying via an approved agent, they will submit your application through their platform on the portal.

faq.question: Is there an application fee?
faq.answer: A €50 processing fee applies to all direct applicants. This is non-refundable; however, this fee will be deducted from your final fee amount.

faq.question: Can the application fee be waived?
faq.answer: The application fee applies to direct students only and cannot be waived. Students who apply through TUS Official Agents are not charged this fee.

faq.question: Can I switch programmes if I begin my course and don’t like it?
faq.answer: If you come to Ireland to study a degree, you will be granted immigration permission for a specific programme at an approved higher education provider. Only in very exceptional circumstances will you be allowed to change programmes during the first year of your studies.

faq.question: I have family living in the EU; would this mean that I’d be entitled to EU fees? What is the process?
faq.answer: EU fees are assessed based on your individual residency in the state, excluding periods of study. If eligible, you would need to apply through the domestic route via the CAO, which opens on November 5th at 12:00 noon and closes on February 1st at 5:00 pm.

faq.question: How long must I wait to hear of a decision on my application?
faq.answer: There is a two-week turnaround time from the date your application is submitted. This allows collaboration with academic staff to fully review and determine an applicant's eligibility.

faq.question: Will I need to upload a portfolio during my application?
faq.answer: For some programmes, particularly in the Art disciplines, you will need to showcase your knowledge and skills through a portfolio.

faq.question: Is there financial support that can be offered by the college?
faq.answer: Unfortunately, we do not offer any grants. However, the Limerick campus can facilitate payment plans. It's essential to ensure that studying abroad is within your financial means for the duration of your studies.

faq.question: Can I apply to multiple courses on the application portal?
faq.answer: No, you must apply for one course under one profile at any given time. However, you are permitted to change your course choice before arrival, provided you meet the eligibility criteria.

faq.question: Is every applicant entitled to a scholarship? How does this work?
faq.answer: Generally, most students will be eligible to receive one of our scholarships. You must have a GPA of 60% or higher to avail of our lowest scholarship.

faq.question: Can I start the application process and return to complete it later?
faq.answer: Yes, you can save your application as a draft and return to it later if you require more time to research your course choice.

faq.question: Can I apply for any course?
faq.answer: Within reason, it's best to apply for a course aligned with your previous studies or future career goals. For students from a non-cognate area of study, there are Higher Diplomas that can act as bridging courses if you haven't studied the foundations of the discipline.
